Title: Object: Madame Josephine the Landlady of the Hotel Constantinople in a Turkish Dress
Series: Sir David Wilkie's Sketches in Turkey, Syria & Egypt, 1840 & 1841
Description: Portrait, full length kneeling on a couch to left, glancing towards the viewer, left hand reaching across her to the back of the sofa, holding up a handkerchief in her right hand, wearing a gown with broad panels over the skirt and hanging from the wrists, an embroidered jacket over her blouse and a tall headdress with a veil, in a room with a window in the background to left. Hand-coloured lithograph printed in grey and beige
Curator's comments: From a set of lithographs 'Drawn on Stone by Joseph Nash', published in two volumes, London, 1843 and 1846 (1918,0205.2-8). See ODNB for Nash
Bibliographic references: Abbey Travel / Travel in Aquatint and lithography 1770-1860 from the library of J.R.Abbey (379.24)
